{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ねずみ}}
Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=ねずみ|根|tr1=ne|t1=root|pos1=more specifically signifying somewhere hidden away|住み|tr2=sumi|pos2=the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{ja-l|住む}} ''sumu'', “to live in a place, to reside”}}, meaning roughly “one who lives in hidden places”. {{rendaku2|sort=ねずみ|sumi|zumi}}

====Pronunciation====
* {{ja-pron|ねずみ|y=k|acc=h|acc_ref=NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ねずみ|ネズミ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=ねずみ'|zoology}} a [[mouse]], a [[rat]]
# general term for members of [[superfamily]] ''[[Muroidea]]'', including [[mouse|mice]], [[rat]]s, [[vole]]s, [[hamster]]s, [[gerbil]]s, and other similar [[rodent]]s
# short for {{m|ja|鼠色|tr=nezumi iro}}: the [[colour]] [[grey]], sometimes more specifically a [[dark]] [[grey]] [[colour]]

=====Usage notes=====
Japanese does not generally distinguish between mice and rats, and both are commonly called ''nezumi''. If a distinction is needed, speakers may use the adjectives {{m|ja|大きい|tr=ōkii||large}} or {{m|ja|小さい|tr=chīsai||small}}, or may use the word {{m|ja|マウス|tr=mausu||mouse|pos=borrowed from either German or English}}.

{{U:ja:biology|ネズミ}}

Note that, although the Japanese term {{ja-l|子年}} ({{ja-l|||nezumidoshi}}, {{ja-l|||nedoshi}}) for The Year of the Rat in the [[Chinese]] [[zodiac]] does derive from this same ''nezumi'' term, it is not written with this {{lang|ja|鼠}} [[kanji]].

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|鼠色|ねずみ いろ}}: {{qualifier|UK}} [[grey]], {{qualifier|US}} [[gray]]
* {{ja-r|鼠衣|ねずみごろも}}: simple [[grey]] [[clerical]] [[robes]]
* {{ja-r|鼠食|ねずみくい}}: something that has been [[chew]]ed on by [[mouse|mice]] or [[rat]]s
* {{ja-r|鼠穴|ねずみあな}}: a [[mousehole]], a [[rathole]]
{{der-mid}}
* {{ja-r|水畑鼠|みずはた ねずみ}}: the [[European]] [[water vole]], ''[[Arvicola amphibius]]'', formerly ''[[Arvicola terrestris]]''.
* {{ja-r|火鼠|ひ ねずみ}}: fire rat
{{der-bottom}}
